metadata.titel_preek: A God Not to Believe in

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Holy One of Israel intervenes in history to deliver the oppressed and judge the proud, independent of human need or cultural fashion.

tekstueel_bewijs: He who brings out their host by number
The Lord has bared his holy arm
I will send to Babylon and break down all the bars
God passes through people to bring forth justice
justice and righteousness in the earth
Before me no god was formed

ontvanger.identificatie: The poor, the oppressed, and the 'witnessing' congregation
tekstueel_bewijs: deliverer of the poor and the oppressed
the women praying in the rain
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is positioned as a Receiver/Witness rather than the Subject.

tekstueel_bewijs: He will pass through people to help us
God passes through people to bring forth justice
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; humans are the instrumental Helpers.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help manifesting through historical action.

tegenstander.identificatie: Imperial powers, cultural apathy, and 'man-made religion'
tekstueel_bewijs: arrogance and heedlessness that goes with hegemony
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just personal sin but the 'world-dominating presumptions' of empires and the 'weakening of traditional faith' in the face of intellectual scorn.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The church acts as a 'counter-voice' to witness to God's justice.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church/Congregation
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Witness/Justice for the homeless and prisoners
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The church's action is a response to being 'chosen' and 'witnessing' what God has already done.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: The Holy One → Salvation/Justice → The Oppressed/Church

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord has comforted his people.
God creates, elects, loves, judges, and rescues.
He blows upon them, and they wither.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You will have an idea of who the God of Abraham is.
Will you become proud and self-satisfied?

voorbeelden: Who is going to be the counter-voice?
God does it because it is God’s will.
Have you not known? Have you not heard?
so that you may know and believe me
God will not come down. But he will pass through people.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's 'Ability' (Pouvoir) over human 'Obligation' (Devoir). The focus is on God's ontological power to intervene.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Psychic NY/Mainline drift) to ~S1 (James Wood's rebellion) to S1 (Isaiah's God).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God is not a 'therapeutic device' but a 'living, active, intervening God' who exists regardless of human belief.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the 'man-made God' is treated as a dangerous delusion that leads to imperial arrogance.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It explicitly rejects anthropocentric 'needs-based' religion and places God as the primary actor in history.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Listen to what those Liberian women... have to say.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Besides me there is no savior.
We don’t believe in God because we 'need' to. That would make our need primary and God secondary.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical and contemporary figures (Isaiah, Liberian women, Lincoln) are used as 'witnesses' or 'helpers' through whom God acts, not as models for moral imitation.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Isaiah (as a voice for God's Word)
Lincoln (as a theologian of God's judgment)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: N/A - The sermon already provides a theocentric reading.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Humility and awe; shift from self-reliance to reliance on the 'Holy One'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is grounded in God's nature, not human response.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative programs are tightly integrated; the secondary program (ethics/witness) is clearly a subset of the primary program (God's action).
spanning_punten: The tension between God's transcendence and His 'passing through people' (immanence).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Breaking down the bars of Babylon; delivering from oppression.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is not explicitly named, but the 'Word' functions as the empowering force.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as 'imperial arrogance' and 'forgetting God', which invites historical judgment.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the active verbs of salvation and judgment.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The congregation might identify as the 'powerful' rather than the 'witness'.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Reinforce that the church's 'greatness' is entirely derivative.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Connect the 'new thing' God is doing more directly to the congregation's specific local mission.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in theocentric preaching that avoids the trap of therapeutic moralism.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Babylon-on-the-Hudson' metaphor, semiotics reveals that the 'engine' of the sermon is God's 'Pouvoir-faire' (Power-to-do).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the historical context of Second Isaiah; semiotics shows how the preacher maps that structure onto 21st-century NYC.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas's model exposes that the 'Liberian women' are not the Subjects of the story, but the 'Helpers' through whom the true Subject (God) acts.

volledige_subject_lijst: The Lord (has comforted, has bared his arm)
The Holy One (will come down, will pass through)
appendices.notities: The sermon follows Rutledge's rule almost perfectly.
